boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




REalM presents us Iris, a 17 year old girl who, after a harsh sensation of falling in her dreams, wakes up in her room.

Yet, something feels out of place, and she feels the need to get out of home. By doing so, Iris discovers that she has woken in a strange place, isolated, with only one tree, her house and a house very similar to hers. Inside she finds a being like her, but like a shadow. It tells her to find the "effects" hidden in the world.

On her way out, Iris sees strange portals hanging from the tree. After touching one, she is transported to a new world, radically different from the one she was in.

Iris realizes that to know more of this world, she'll have to find the "effects" the shadow was talking about.

REalM is a 2D side scroller where exploring and gaining new powers is key to returning home.


An open world: Explore the world in any order you like, in the end all that matters is getting back home.
Gain special powers (Effects): Get new abilities from the inhabitants of this world to aid you in exploring and solving new puzzles.

The devil is in the details: You'll find throughout REalM that everything has its meaning and that all is connected. The detail put in the art of the game is of uttermost importance.
A unique world: this bizarre world is unlike any other

boardgame.name: Emergents: Genesis – The Deckbuilding Game
boardgame.description:
Emergents: Genesis is a PvP multi-player superhero-themed deckbuilding game, set in the Emergents Universe created by game designer and comic creator, Brian David-Marshall and features art from a host of best-selling and award-winning comic book artists headlined by Steve Ellis.

Emergents: Genesis is a 2-4 player deckbuilding game that any age can enjoy, and a game lasts generally between 30-60 minutes. Everything you will need to play the game comes inside a box of Emergents: Genesis.

In Emergents: Genesis, players take on the role of powerful superheroes—known in this world as Emergents—and battle against the other players in the game to be the last person standing.

Players customize their decks based on four classes of superpowers in a fast-paced game that can be played by two to four players. Designed by Urban Island Games and Top8Magic, Emergents: Genesis introduces innovative, interactive mechanics to the deckbuilding game that will appeal to all fans of both the superhero genre and interactive card games.

Gameplay Description

Players are dealt two Emergents face down and choose one of the heroes to start the game with. The object of the game is reduce all of the other players' heroes to zero health by attacking them while also building your deck and customizing your Emergent's superpowers.

Each player begins with a deck containing nine Skill cards and three Attack cards. Cards that generate Skill are used to purchase additional cards while cards that generate Attack are used to defeat your opponents.

Each player shuffles their deck and draws six cards. They can purchase basic cards that advance their Emergent's class strategy or purchase more expensive cards that are available dealt face-up from the deck. Cards that are purchased get put in the player's discard pile and whenever a player can't draw a card they shuffle their deck. At the end of each turn, a player discards their hand and draws six cards from their deck.

As the game progresses, players will ideally create a deck that showcases their heroes' unique abilities and allows them to be the last player standing. While many deckbuilding games are points races, where someone crosses a finish line and wins, Emergents: Genesis requires you to defeat your opponents, which means you can defend yourself if you have purchased the right cards along the way.

All you need to do is make sure that the guests arrive in proper groups and help them to bring the right gifts and and make sure someone brings the gifts and…Oh dear!

The objective of the game is to create complete sets of guests and gifts, and then to claim the set when completed. Players take turns playing a guest and or a gift on a set until it is completed. Each guest requires at least one other guest and up to two gifts in order for the set to be complete. The player who completes the set collects it, and the player who collects the most cards by the end of the game wins!

boardgame.name: Insight Out
boardgame.description:
Insight Out is "the game that gets your family talking."

From the box:
"The easy-to-learn format is perfect for any child age 3 or older. Two sets of age-appropriate question cards promote communication and discussion with children of any age."

Insight Out is a roll-and-move game in which players move their cards along a track, drawing cards and answering questions or performing actions based on the spaces they land on. Questions are designed to stimulate discussion among family members, and there are two levels--for younger and older children. If a player chooses not to answer the question or do the action drawn, he or she may go back to the original space and re-roll once. If the re-roll also results in drawing a card, then the player must do the action on the card or go back to the original space and lose his or her turn. The winner is the first player to reach the Finish space.

An advanced game adds a few extra rules, such as spaces where cards may be given to another player and the need to roll the exact number to land on the finish space.

boardgame.name: Domino Discovery Fractions
boardgame.description:
From the box:
"Domino Discovery is an exciting matching game that reinforces basic learning skills and provides hours of fun. It is an easy and creative way to involve children in learning activities."

Domino Discovery Fractions is an educational take on Dominoes, with the added element of requiring players to recognize and match equivalent fractions as well as fractions expressed as numbers and as pictures. From a total of 40 dominoes, each player is dealt five and one starting domino is placed on the table. In turn, each player must find a domino with a fraction that matches one end of a domino already in play, and play their domino against that one. If they have not matches, they must draw from the draw pile until they can play a domino. Play ends when one player successfully plays all their dominoes.

In order to play successfully, players must use their knowledge of equivalent fractions (such as 1/2 = 2/4) as well as understanding visual representations of fractions (such as knowing that a picture of a circle with one of three pieces colored in is equal to 1/3).

Space Station Disaster is a light strategy game. You and your opponents are building a space station by laying out hex tiles. But most of the tiles contain disasters like aliens, radiation, and fire. Your goal is to use matching equipment cards to fix the disasters. If you fix a disaster you get a point. The game plays in 30-60 minutes depending on the number of players. With a different order of tiles each game you get a unique experience every time.

boardgame.name: Citizen Cane
boardgame.description:
Citizen Cane is a dice-drafting game in which 2-4 Christmas elves vie to build their gift-building empires!

Each turn, players roll a die for each elf on their team with up to two re-rolls - then all the rolled dice are pooled and players draft the numbers they want for that turn. Dice are spent to join elf unions that grant players special abilities, buy things with candy-cane currency at the quartermaster's stores or get on with the work of building, wrapping and tagging gifts for Santa.

Citizen Cane is a single-sheet game that relies only on a few items most gamers will already have around the house, and is intended to be printed on the inside face of Christmas cards for gamers.

boardgame.name: Symtactics
boardgame.description:
Symtactics is a simulation of tactical urbanism set in the Hong Kong region in the year of 2047. It involves both tactical as well as strategic decision making. It was printed in an edition of 20,000 for the Hong Kong edition of the New City Reader which was created specifically for the 'Uneven Growth' exhibition on view at the Museum of Modern Art from Nov 22, 2014 to May 10, 2015.

Ideally, Symtactics is played with 5 players. All players must complete tactical interventions at 8 sites around the Hong Kong region while dealing with catastrophic events. Players can either play for a collective win, working together to beat an ever increasing inequality meter or they can play individually.

Interventions are created by matching resource cards to icons printed on the site hexes. A player must successfully match three icons or use wildcard resources as dictated by the current round's market situation. Once an intervention is completed, the resources used go into a pile as marked on the board. There are 8 piles that correspond to the sites on the map and another 8 towards the north of the board, corresponding to the development of global inequality.

boardgame.name: That's Mine
boardgame.description:
Choose your card wisely, then wager victory points to gain the advantage over your competition.

The game of rock, paper, scissors has been played in various forms for hundreds of years. That's Mine is a fast paced time filler game that adapts this enduring mechanic to a card game. It adds support for more than two players and introduces a risk/reward wagering element.

Each round involves all players choosing a numbered card with rock, paper or scissors and resolving battle as expected. Things get interesting when players wager existing victory points to influence when they enter the competition. Every hand is resolved leaving only one winner with a simple yet decisive tiebreaking system.

Each wager builds the kitty and the survivor exclaims "That's Mine" while claiming their winnings.

boardgame.name: Idiom Link
連線字龍
boardgame.description:
English description:

Idiom Link is played with a thirty-six grid square dial. Players have to make words. Each word has to start with the last character of the previous word.

Chinese description:
「連線字龍」遊戲為ＭＪ工作室所設計的中文成語填字遊戲。(ＭＪ工作室成員為Michael Lou樓齊賢、Jack Li李子建)
「連線字龍」遊戲是由三十六個格子所組成的方形字盤，字盤中置入了十個「字龍文字」，可組合成三組頭尾相接的成語，就是後一個成語的頭一個字必須與前一個成語的最後一個字相同（例：「花言巧語」的「語」，接「語重心長」的「語」）。請根據字盤中十個字龍文字的提示，先確定可組合成那三組頭尾相接的成語；再將字盤中的十個字龍文字按照三組成語的頭尾順序，在線條不交錯、格子不重覆的方式下，用一條線將字盤中的三十六個格子全數串連起來（即以第一組成語的頭一個字為起點，第三組成語的最後一個字為終點），即可完成極具高難度的「連線字龍」遊戲。

boardgame.name: Before Scotland: 750 AD – Kingdoms
boardgame.description:
Set in 8th century Northern Britain, Before Scotland: 750 AD - Kingdoms is a tactical combat deck building strategy game. It is historical in nature with a rich context and set of mechanics drawn from original sources.

The game begins in 750 AD and lets you play as one of four nations who struggle for supremacy: the Angles, Britons, Gaels, or Picts. After choosing a leader and moral cause that give special abilities to your kingdom, each player draws up to 7 random cards from their Kingdom Reserve deck. They travel through the Environment and scout the Terrain at the battlefield; these are event cards that alter the impending engagement. From the cards-in-hand (i.e. the Warband), each player may select up to 3 Warband Unit cards that face-off with a competing kingdom. After a simultaneous reveal, cards are resolved one-versus-one with additional Supply, Tactics, or Training cards from the Warband that are used to modify the encounter. Winning cards enter the Hoard. Losing cards are flushed into the Barrow. The game ends when the Kingdom Reserves are exhausted and the player with the largest hoard wins.

This game is targeted at the casual gamer and is a gateway to the more in-depth title Before Scotland: 750 AD - Empires which layers in a working economy and geographic constraints.

boardgame.name: Princess Provocateur
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

Since ancient times, demonic overlords and megalomaniacal wizards have kidnapped princesses to further their nefarious plots, hiding them away in trapped towers, mysterious mazes,
or dangerous dungeons. When all hope seemed lost, a hero would appear to defeat the villain and win glory, wealth, and the heart of the princess...it was tradition, after all.

Well, you know what? Tradition stinks. Here you are, stuck in a dank cell with a few other princesses, sitting on moldy straw in cold, unsanitary conditions, awaiting some foolhardy,
so-called “hero,” who for all you know may already by dead! Besides which, you and the other princesses aren’t so keen on being treated as a prize.

You aren’t the princesses of yore – each of you is capable in your own right. You don’t need a hero to save the day. Most of these guards look like pushovers, anyway. If a barbarian, a kid with a funny hat, or a pair of mustachioed plumbers can defeat a villain, why can’t a bunch of princesses who have been schooled in fencing, problem-solving, and leadership?

Time to kick tradition in the butt.

Using mechanics similar to Heist, this game turns fairy tales on their ear, as not-so-helpless princesses tell the story of how they escaped the clutches of the villain-of-the-week, all whilst avoiding the irritating and domineering hero.
